thread.title: Tunisia: Projected Growth Rate Revised Downwards to 0.5 Percent - Minister
thread.title_full: Tunisia: Projected Growth Rate Revised Downwards to 0.5 Percent - Minister

title: Tunisia: Projected Growth Rate Revised Downwards to 0.5 Percent - Minister
text:
Tunisia: Drafting of Five-Year Development Plan Gets Underway 
Al Kasbah — The projected growth rate for 2015 was revised downwards from 3% to 0.5% in the draft supplementary finance law, Finance Minister Slim Chaker said Thursday at a press conference. 
This is due to the economic crisis which Tunisia is going through, the minister said; the country will consequently post losses of about 461 MTD. 
Countering terrorism will also entail the loss of two percentage points of growth. 
The draft supplementary finance law earmarked an additional 306 MTD for the National Defence and Interior Ministries as well as customs, the minister indicated. 20% of development expenditure will finance the purchase of weapons and counter-terrorism equipment. Tunisia
